business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cabinet clears terms of reference for 8th Pay CommissionInformation and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed that the government has finalised the commission's composition, mandate and timelines.

What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Peyush Bansal's Lenskart IPO opens on October 31. Here's all you need to knowPeyush Bansal-led Lenskart is set to hit the primary market on October 31 with its Rs 7,278 crore IPO. Backed by a strong brand presence and rapid expansion, the issue is among the most awaited listings of 2025.

6 hidden home loan traps your bank won't tell you. Expert shares smart hacksBuying your dream home can quickly turn stressful when hidden costs and surprise clauses appear. From processing fees to "mandatory" insurance, a tax expert shares six practical hacks every borrower should know before signing their home loan papers.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Why quitting SIPs within 3 years is a costly mistakeStarting an SIP is easy, staying invested isn't. An expert explains why most Indian investors quit too soon, and how this one mistake can cost them lakhs in the long run.

MCX glitch halts gold, silver futures trade; check latest updateIn a series of updates issued throughout the morning, MCX stated that the issue was being addressed and that trading would now commence from its Disaster Recovery (DR) site. However, the exchange did not specify a fresh start time.

Vodafone Idea share price: What are analysts saying after AGR ruling?Analysts see fresh hope for Vodafone Idea after the AGR ruling, with Motilal Oswal, Emkay, and Citi turning positive on the stock and projecting scope for further upside.

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid profit booking; PSU banks in focus on FDI cap buzzAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 66.76 points higher at 84,845.60, while the NSE Nifty50 edged up 14.25 points to 25,980.30.

Paramount to cut 1,000 jobs ahead of merger with Warner BrosThe job cuts, which follow the $8.4 billion merger between Skydance Media and Paramount Global, would impact roughly 5% of Paramount's employees based on its workforce prior to the completion of the deal.

Gold price at Rs 1.21 lakh, silver dips sharply: More correction ahead?According to analysts, the dip was both expected and healthy after gold prices shot up from nearly Rs 75,000 to Rs 1.30 lakh in just a few months. A correction of about 10–15% was on the cards, which would bring prices closer to Rs 1.15 lakh per 10 grams.

Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

Gold, silver prices are falling. Should you buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are slipping as global optimism rises and profit-taking kicks in. Experts explain what's driving the fall and whether buyers should wait before investing.

Hospital bills are rising. Here's how to make your health insurance smarterAs medical inflation pushes treatment and hospital costs higher, insurers are reworking pricing and policies. Here's how flexible plans, wellness incentives, and smart choices can help you keep your cover affordable.

entertainment.headline: Enrique Iglesias arrives in India for his two-day concert in Mumbai. Watch Spanish singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias landed in India on Tuesday ahead of his two-day concert in Mumbai. He waved at the cameras and interacted with the paparazzi at Mumbai's Kalina Airport.

High Court halts Ravi Mohan from using Bro Code as title for film, team reacts Delhi High Court has temporarily stopped Ravi Mohan Studios from using the title 'Bro Code' due to a trademark dispute. The decision escalates legal tensions between the filmmakers and Indo-Spirit Beverages over brand rights.

Nobody Wants This Season 2 is couch potato's guide to non-toxic love done right 'Nobody Wants This Season 2' on Netflix turns ordinary domesticity into a lesson on emotional maturity. Starring Adam Brody and Kristen Bell, the show proves that communication, vulnerability, and humour can make modern love beautifully non-toxic.

Navya Nanda shares insight into Bachchan family: We don't fight, we debate Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter, Navya Naveli Nanda, recently talked about the dynamics in the Bachchan household. She highlighted that her family often has conversations around topics that are relevant today and that matter.

Kantara Chapter 1 makers clarify early OTT release: Deal was done 3 years ago 'Kantara: Chapter 1' will premiere on Prime Video on October 31, just weeks after its theatrical release. Hombale Films clarifies that the early OTT drop stems from a three-year-old agreement.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Wildcards Prajin, Divya Ganesh, Amit Bhargav enter show 'Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9' has introduced three new wildcard contestants to intensify the competition. The new entries promise fresh drama amid warnings over violent behaviour inside the house.

Travis Scott to Enrique Iglesias: Is live music India's hottest cultural currency Mumbai is set to welcome Spanish singer Enrique Iglesias for a major concert at MMRDA Grounds. American rapper Travis Scott also performed in India recently. India Today offers insights on India's rapidly growing live music industry supported by changing consumer habits and government initiatives.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: College-themed task stirs drama The latest season of Bigg Boss Kannada introduced a fun task this week, setting up a retro-themed college with house captain Mutant Raghu heading the gang as the college principal.

Mahhi Vij reacts to Jay Bhanushali's post with daughter Tara amid divorce talk Amid reports of marital issues, Mahhi Vij commented on a light-hearted video shared by Jay Bhanushali with their daughter Tara.  One of the most popular couples on Indian television, the duo have reportedly filed for divorce.

Vidya Balan recalls being offered debut film Parineeta at Enrique's Mumbai concert Enrique Iglesias is set to perform in Mumbai after 20 years with a two-day concert. Vidya Balan recalled her debut film offer during his 2004 concert, highlighting a memorable career moment.

Priyamani opens up on pay disparity: I know my worth, I charge what I deserve 'The Family Man' actor Priyamani shared her views on gender-based pay gaps, saying she focuses on her market value rather than comparisons with male co-stars.

Rashmika Mandanna on long shooting hours: We should stop glorifying overworking The debate on work hours in the Indian film industry is heating up, with actor Rashmika Mandanna calling for fixed schedules and healthier work conditions.

Rohan Mehra slams BB 19's Tanya, Kunickaa and Neelam for body-shaming Ashnoor TV actor Rohan Mehra has called out 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Tanya Mittal, Kunickaa Sadanand and Neelam Giri on social media. He slammed the trio for body-shaming Ashnoor Kaur on the reality show.

Rukmini Vasanth shares rare behind-the-scenes glimpse from Kantara Chapter 1 set Rukmini Vasanth has shared unseen moments from the making of 'Kantara Chapter 1', revealing her intense preparation and behind-the-scenes discussions with director Rishab Shetty.

Vivek Oberoi says Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana will be a landmark for Indian cinema Vivek Oberoi believes Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana' will take Indian cinema to a global level, and calls it "India's answer to Hollywood epics." The actor, who also donated his fee from the film to support children battling cancer, said he's proud to be part of such a monumental project.

Aamir Khan, Urmila Mantondkar's Rangeela to hit theatres again on this date Marking three decades since its original premiere, the 1995 Bollywood classic film 'Rangeela' will be re-released. The movie will hit theatres on  November 28 in a new 4K HD restored version.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 50: Evicted contestants' return sparks major drama Evicted contestants made a dramatic comeback in 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9', shaking up the nomination process with emotional confrontations, unexpected alliances, and shocking betrayals.

Rupali Ganguly is all hearts and tears over Amul's tribute to her kaka Satish Shah Amul has honoured late actor Satish Shah with a special tribute campaign, recognising his decades-long contribution to Indian entertainment after his recent passing. The gesture drew responses from industry colleagues, including Rupali Ganguly.

Baseer Ali: I am hurt that Nehal used me in Bigg Boss 19 After his eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19', Baseer Ali opened up about feeling sidelined by the makers, claiming he received no feedback while others were guided. In an exclusive chat with India Today, he addressed his bond with Nehal Chudasama and Farrhana Bhatt.

general news.headline: Cyclone Montha landfall process begins, to cross Andhra coast in 3-4 hoursCyclone Montha on Tuesday approached near the Andhra Pradesh coast as the landfall process began, and it would take three to four hours to cross the state late at night, the weather department said.

Cyclone Montha Live: Landfall begins, Andhra bans vehicle movement, imposes night curfew in 7 districtsCyclone Montha Live Updates: Severe cyclonic storm Montha has begun to make landfall between Machilipatnam and Kakinada, bringing strong winds, heavy rainfall and coastal flooding risks across Andhra Pradesh. One death has been reported so far, while authorities have opened relief camps, issued safety advisories, and suspended train services in affected regions. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

1 job per family, Rs 2,500 for women: Mahagathbandhan goes with populist playbookWith just days left for the Bihar elections, the Mahagathbandhan released its poll manifesto, outlining a wide-ranging agenda focusing on employment, welfare, and governance reforms.

Election Commission asks Prashant Kishor to explain 2 voter enrolments in 2 statesThe notice, served by the Returning Officer of Bihar's Kargahar constituency, cites Section 17 of the Representation of the People Act, which prohibits dual registration, and asks Kishor to respond within three days.

Delhi HC ruling, and alimony law firestorm ignited by Yuzvendra ChahalThe Chahal divorce and a recent Delhi High Court ruling have ignited a nationwide debate on the future of alimony in India. This discussion centers on financial independence, fairness, and legal expectations in modern marriages.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cloud seeding conducted over parts of Delhi, artificial rain likely soonThe first full-scale cloud seeding trial has taken place in Delhi to tackle severe post-Diwali smog. The success of the effort could significantly lower the city's hazardous air pollution levels.

A foreign country using Pakistan soil to hit Afghanistan with drones?A bombshell revelation has emerged in the Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks in Turkey. Pakistan, for the first time, has admitted that it cannot prevent drone strikes inside Afghanistan due to a secret agreement with a foreign country. This comes just months after Islamabad began strengthening defence and strategic ties with the US, amid President Donald Trump's forceful public demand for the return of Bagram airbase.

Plane flies into Hurricane Melissa, goosebump-inducing video reveals nature's mightThe stunning footage was captured by a US Air Force crew, known as "Hurricane Hunters." They flew directly into the eye of the Category 5 storm scheduled to make landfall in Jamaica as the strongest to hit the island since record-keeping began in 1851.

Bengal man dies by suicide over NRC fear, triggers Mamata Banerjee-BJP spatA 57-year-old man's death in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district allegedly over fears related to NRC has led to a heated exchange between Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and BJP's Amit Malviya.

Storm of the century: Hurricane Melissa barrels toward Jamaica, catastrophe fearedJamaica and eastern Cuba are bracing for the impact of Category 5 Hurricane Melissa, which the US National Hurricane Centre warns could be the strongest storm ever to hit the region. The Cuban military has been deployed for rescue and cleanup efforts as Jamaicans rush to secure homes and supplies.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Satellite images show the monstrous nature of Cyclone MonthaStriking satellite images from Isro's INSAT-3DR satellite captured the swirling mass of clouds and the dense, spiralling eyewall, vividly illustrating the storm's monstrous scale as it barrels towards land.​

Sridhar Vembu's vaccine comment is not science, it's dangerous speculationWhen a billionaire entrepreneur starts talking like a vaccine sceptic, the harm goes far beyond a social media post. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu's recent claim that India's sharp rise in autism is linked to "too many childhood vaccines" is more than just misinformed; it's reckless

Rising crimes by delivery agents, cab drivers spark fear among Bengaluru residentsBengaluru has seen a spike in crimes involving app-based delivery, cab, and auto drivers. Multiple cases of assault, harassment, and abuse have been reported, raising serious concerns about commuter safety.

'My partner is a hobosexual, but does that make her a gold-digger?'As living costs climb in metro cities, a new kind of relationship has quietly emerged: the hobosexual kind. But when affection comes bundled with dependence, how do you know if your partner's staying for love or if they are actually a gold digger?

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

Vijay ferries families of Karur victims 400 km away for meeting, sparks rowActor-poitician Vijay shuttled families of 37 Karur stampede victims' 400 km to a resort in Mahabalipuram for a private apology. But the move has seemingly sparked a row even as he claimed he could not get the administration's permission to visit Karur.

Indian-origin textile tycoon gunned down in Canada just outside his homeA 68-year-old Indian-origin businessman was shot dead in his car outside his Abbotsford home in Canada's British Columbia. Police said the shooting appears targeted. No arrests have been made so far, and the Integrated Homicide Investigation Team is probing the case.

Hello, Teddy Boy: Assam BJP mocks Priyank Kharge after his jab at Himanta SarmaThe feud between Himanta Biswa Sarma and Priyank Kharge erupted after the Karnataka Minister allegedly told a news channel that semiconductor investments meant for his state were being diverted towards Gujarat and Assam, after being "arm-twisted" by the Centre.

Will it rain in Delhi? Science behind cloud seeding conducted over national capitalAll eyes will be on Delhi as scientists, environmentalists and weather officials look for rain. This one artificially induced to curb pollution and smog levels in parts of the capital.

Shreyas Iyer out of ICU, recovering well after rib injury in Sydney ODIIndia's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer is out of the ICU and has stepped his recovery from the rib injury he suffered during the third match of the series against Australia in Sydney. Sources have said that Shreyas has started talking to his teammates and eating solid food.
What the war in Venezuela could look likeUS President Donald Trump has signalled imminent military action in Venezuela. Here is a look at the three broad options for the US in South America.

Tejashwi Yadav vows to legalise toddy in dry state Bihar if Mahagathbandhan winsWhile campaigning in Bihar's Saran, Tejashwi Yadav promised to legalise toddy in Bihar, which has been a dry state since 2016, Mahagathbandhan comes to power in the state.

sports.headline: England great James Anderson receives knighthood for services to cricket England fast-bowling legend James Anderson has been knighted for his services to cricket. The 43-year-old, who took 704 Test wickets over a 22-year career, received the honour from the Princess Royal at Windsor Castle after retiring from Tests in 2024.

Rizwan declines Pakistan central contract over dispute with PCB: Reports Mohammad Rizwan has reportedly declined the PCB's 2025–26 central contract, a development that follows his removal as ODI captain and exclusion from the T20I series against South Africa.

Mohammed Shami ready to make India comeback: There is cricket left in me Mohammed Shami has said that he is keeping himself ready to make an Indian comeback after continuing his fine run in the Ranji Trophy this season. Shami last played for India during the Champions Trophy this year.

Dani Carvajal out for three months after knee surgery post El Clasico win Real Madrid defender Dani Carvajal has undergone successful knee surgery after El Clasico. The injury sidelines him for up to three months, impacting Madrid's defensive options.

South Africa have a really good shot at winning semis vs England: Laura Wolvaardt Women's World Cup 2025, ENG vs SA: Laura Wolvaardt said that South Africa are more than capable of taking down England in the semi-final on Wednesday in Guwahati. Earlier in the tournament, the Proteas had lost to the Brits by 10 wickets after being bowled out for 69.

Alyssa Healy on track to return for semi-final clash against India Australian skipper Alyssa Healy edges closer to a comeback in the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final versus India after clearing a demanding fitness assessment in Mumbai. Her return will be a huge cause of concern for India as Healy earlier slammed a century in group stage clash against the hosts.

Superstar Abhishek Sharma ready to play all three formats for India: Michael Clarke Michael Clarke feels that Abhishek Sharma is ready to play all three formats for India ahead of the T20I series against Australia. Abhishek is in imperial form in the shortest format of the game.

Alex Carey ready for Barmy Army taunts as Ashes stumping row still echoes in 2025 Alex Carey is bracing for Barmy Army taunts as Australia prepare to host England in the 2025 Ashes. Two years after his stumping of Jonny Bairstow sparked a Spirit of Cricket storm, the wicketkeeper says he is ready for the noise and focused on the cricket.

England are also under pressure: Wolvaardt wants South Africa to stay calm in semis Laura Wolvaardt has urged South Africa to stay calm and trust their skills ahead of the Women's World Cup semi-final against England, emphasising mental strength over skills.

Gukesh gets his revenge on Hikaru Nakamura, but plays it cool to win over internet Gukesh Dommaraju kept his cool to beat Hikaru Nakamura at the 2025 Clutch Chess Showdown, just weeks after their viral Checkmate controversy. His calm revenge win and quiet composure won over fans and the internet alike.

Sources have said that Shreyas has started talking to his teammates and eating solid food.

His calm revenge win and quiet composure won over fans and the internet alike.

Sources have said that Shreyas has started talking to his teammates and eating solid food.

AUS vs IND 1st T20I Predicted XI: Will India continue with 3 spinners in Canberra?India are set to play Australia in the first T20I at Manuka Oval without key all-rounder Hardik Pandya. The team has a tough task of fielding the best possible combination in the absence of their seasoned all-rounder.

Joe Root leads wishes for England before Women's World Cup semis vs South AfricaEngland women's cricket team prepares to face South Africa in the Women's World Cup semi-final on October 29. Key players and male teammates have expressed strong support ahead of the crucial knockout match.

How a simple chat with Temba Bavuma sparked Simon Harmer's return to Test cricketA chat between Temba Bavuma and Simon Harmer after the WTC final reignited the off-spinner's Test career. After years away, Harmer's return brought experience, balance, and 1,000 first-class wickets to a rejuvenated South African spin attack.

Smriti Mandhana among Player of the Tournament nominees for Women's World CupStar Indian batter Smriti Mandhana leads the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 award nominees after topping the tournament run charts, including a crucial hundred against New Zealand, and joining Deepti Sharma in record-breaking all-round feats.

Messi remains open to playing World Cup 2026 despite age, fitness concernsLionel Messi has expressed his strong desire to participate in the 2026 World Cup, calling the opportunity to defend Argentina's title "extraordinary." The Argentine maestro admitted that his participation will depend on his fitness and age at the end of the day.

England sweat over Sophie Ecclestone's fitness ahead of South Africa semi-finalEngland are sweating over spinner Sophie Ecclestone's fitness ahead of their Women's World Cup semi-final against South Africa, after she sustained a shoulder injury in the last group match against New Zealand.

Mohammed Shami's statement spell hands Bengal 141-run win over GujaratBengal hammered Gujarat by 141 runs in the second round of the Ranji Trophy. Mohammed Shami bowled a riveting spell on the final day of the match, rescuing the hosts from a perilous position.

Suryakumar Yadav needs to find form, can completely destroy teams: Parthiv PatelFormer India cricketer Parthiv Patel believes the upcoming T20I series against Australia will be crucial for skipper Suryakumar Yadav to regain form, as India looks for strong top-order performances in challenging Australian conditions.

The Argentine maestro admitted that his participation will depend on his fitness and age at the end of the day.

Suryakumar Yadav needs to find form, can completely destroy teams: Parthiv PatelFormer India cricketer Parthiv Patel believes the upcoming T20I series against Australia will be crucial for skipper Suryakumar Yadav to regain form, as India looks for strong top-order performances in challenging Australian conditions.

India trusting their unique 3-spinner combination in Australia: SuryakumarIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav said that the team will be trusting its three-spinner combination in the Australia series. Without Hardik Pandya, could this strategy backfire?

Marsh hilariously breaks silence on Test return: Was hoping for a month offMitchell Marsh hilariously reacted to his potential Test return before the Ashes after Andrew McDonald's latest admission about the all-rounder. Marsh hasn't played for Australia since December 2024.

Mandhana attains career-best ODI batting ratings amid dream World Cup campaignIndia's opening batter, Smriti Mandhana, has attained her career-best ratings in the ICC ODI rankings amid her dream World Cup campaign. Mandhana is the leading run scorer of the tournament with 365 runs from seven innings.

India not only ancient home, but modern powerhouse of chess: FIDE PresidentFIDE President Arkady Dvorkovich praised India as not only the ancient home of chess but as a modern powerhouse as well. The FIDE World Cup returns to India for the first time since 2002.

Are Australia prepared to counter Abhishek Sharma's mayhem? Mitchell Marsh revealsAustralia captain Mitchell Marsh says his team is ready to face India's aggressive batter Abhishek Sharma in the upcoming T20I series. Abhishek is the current number-one T20I batter in the world and was recently adjudged Player of the Tournament in Asia Cup 2025.

Real Madrid let off Vinicius Jr. after El Clasico substitution meltdown: ReportReal Madrid has reportedly decided not to punish Vinicius Jr. for his emotional outburst during El Clasico, viewing the situation as an internal matter.

Shreyas Iyer Cheats Death: Out of ICU After Spleen Laceration Scare in SydneyThis special report focuses on the health of Indian ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer following a severe injury in Sydney. Iyer suffered a lacerated spleen during the third ODI against Australia, leading to internal bleeding and admission to an ICU. BCCI Vice President Rajiv Shukla told India Today that 'everything is fine, he's medically stable. But he'll be there for seven or eight days more in the hospital.' Iyer sustained the impact injury after taking a diving catch and was immediately hospitalised after showing signs of extreme distress in the dressing room. Medical experts have described spleen injuries as potentially life-threatening. While Iyer is now out of the ICU and in a general ward, his participation in the upcoming home series against South Africa is in doubt.

I've been working really hard, runs will come eventually: Suryakumar YadavIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has said that he's been working hard behind the scenes to regain his form ahead of the five-match T20I series against Australia. Ever since being appointed the team's full-time captain in July 2024, Suryakumar has scored 330 runs from 20 innings at an average of 18.33 with two fifties to his name.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
